alert.note: Alert for Crittenden; Lee; Phillips (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 05 at 2:08AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Lee, eastern Phillips, south central Crittenden, western DeSoto, Coahoma, Tunica and western Quitman Counties through 245 AM CDT... At 208 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Brickeys to 7 miles northwest of Friars Point to near Crumrod. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Clarksdale, Elaine, Helena-West Helena, St Francis National Park, Jonestown, Friars Point, Walls, Tunica, Horseshoe Lake, Lexa, Belen, Lake Cormorant, Dublin, Dubbs, Brickeys, North Tunica, Dundee, Kings, Sherard and Robinsonville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for eastern Arkansas...northwestern Mississippi...and west Tennessee.
